snippet: Critics say the law in response to student demonstrations prioritizes maintaining order at the expense of free speech.
abstract: Student protests against tuition hikes in Quebec have gained widespread sympathy after the provincial government tried to end them by arresting more than 2,500 people and passing an emergency law limiting demonstrations; critics say law impinges on free speech and other constitutional protections in the name of order and civility; conflict is growing into the greatest political turmoil Canada has seen in decades.
lead_paragraph: Critics say the law in response to student demonstrations prioritizes maintaining order at the expense of free speech.

headline.seo: Emergency Law Broadens Canada’s Sympathy for Quebec Protests
headline.main: Emergency Law Broadens Canada’s Sympathy for Quebec Protests
headline.print_headline: Law Increases Draw of Canada Protests
